title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Pink, yellow and orange colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite left side above drawing on mount: bracket and 1/24; in graphite left side on drawing: "repeat" and bracket; in graphite right side on drawing: "warp" and [arrow]; in graphite upper right on mount: "satin" and"rep" with indicators to design; in graphite upper right corner: 6

Verso in graphite lower right corner: II - 33 [upside down]; in graphite at right: 2 motifs 3 3/8
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Pattern composed of one line of circles separatd by diamonds, followed by a line of squares and diamonds.  Each element is split between yellow and pink, or red, with corresponding shape in short strokes of graphite in the centers

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Pink, yellow and orange colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-451.
